body.p: The Phase 2 amendments relating to the hedge accounting requirements in IAS 39 apply to hedging relationships directly affected by the reform as and when the requirements in paragraphs 102D–102I of IAS 39 cease to apply to a hedging relationship (see paragraphs 102J–102O of IAS 39). Therefore, an entity is required to amend the hedging relationship to reflect the changes required by the reform as and when the uncertainty arising from the reform is no longer present with respect to the hedged risk or the timing and the amount of interest rate benchmark-based cash flows of the hedged item or of the hedging instrument. The scope of the hedging relationships to which the Phase 2 amendments apply is therefore the same as the scope to which the Phase 1 amendments apply, except for the amendment to the separately identifiable requirement, which also applies to the designation of new hedging relationships (see paragraph 102Z3 of IAS 39).
